bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, October 1, 1890

div1.p: Reed requests that he be assigned to duty in Baltimore so that he can pursue post-graduate medical study at Johns Hopkins University. The letter and military endorsements granting him a post as attending surgeon and examiner of recruits in Baltimore are dated from October 1, 1890 to October 4, 1890. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, October 1, 1890
div1.p:
Requests assignment to some
duty in Baltimore Md.
Desires to a take Post Graduate
course - Medicine & Surgery in Johns
Hopkins University. At present
on leave of absence to Jan'y 1891.
but will surrender unexpired portion
if necessary.

Surg. Gen'l recommends that
Asst. Surg. Reed having sur-
rendered his leave of absence, be re-
lieved from duty at Mount Vernon Bks.,
Ala and assigned to duty as attend-
ing Surg. and Examiner of Recruits in Balt. Md.

Respectfully forwarded to the
Adjutant General of the Army
recommending that Captain
Walter Reed Assistant Surgeon,
having surrendered his leave of
absence, be relieved from duty at
Mount Vernon Barracks, Alabama,
and assigned to duty as Attending
Surgeon and Examiner of Recruits at
Baltimore, Maryland.

J H Baxter
Surgeon General
of Army

Approved: By order of
the Secretary of War.

C McKeever
Actg Adjutant General,
A. G. Office.

p.unclear: general manager on leave from Sept 8/90.

div1.p:
Walter Reed
Capt. & Asst. Surg. USA.

Requests assignment to some duty in Baltimore Md.
Desires to take Post Graduate course Med & Surgery in
Johns Hopkins University. At present on leave of absence
to Jan'y 1891, but will surrender unexpired portion if necessary.

Respectfully forwarded to the Adjutant General of the
Army, recommending that Captain Walter Reed, Assistant
Surgeon having surrendered his leave of absence be relieved
from duty at Mount Vernon Barracks, Ala. and assigned
to duty as Attending Surgeon and Examiner of Recruits at
Baltimore, Maryland.
